info.name: Pistolero
info.description: The Pistolero from Valda's Spire of Secrets
info.author: Valda's Spire of Secrets

description.p: Bullets are power, and you have long believed that more bullets equal more power. Your expertise is in delivering a hail of deadly fire to pulverize your enemies. Not every bullet needs to be accurate to make a difference.
Starting at 3rd level, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls made with firearms.

sheet.description: Being within 5ft of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged firearms attack rolls.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you take the Attack action on your turn to attack with a firearm, you can expend a risk die as a bonus action to make two additional ranged firearm attacks with that weapon. These additional attacks always have disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. This weapon can't have the Automatic or Two-Handed property, and you must have a free hand to use this feature.
At 14th level, you can make three additional attacks with disadvantage, instead of two, when you use this feature.

sheet.description: When you take the Attack action on your turn to atk with a firearm, you can expend a risk die to make 2 additional ranged firearm atks with that weapon. These additional atks always have disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. This weapon can't have the Automatic or Two-Handed property, and you must have a free hand to use this feature.

When you take the Attack action on your turn to atk with a firearm, you can expend a risk die to make 3 additional ranged firearm atks with that weapon. These additional atks always have disadvantage, regardless of circumstance. This weapon can't have the Automatic or Two-Handed property, and you must have a free hand to use this feature.

description.p: Starting at 7th level, you have mastered the art of quickly reloading your weapon. On your turn, you can reload a single one-handed firearm without using an action or bonus action.

sheet.description: On your turn, you can reload a single one-handed firearm without using an action or bonus action.

description.p: At 10th level, when you make a ranged firearm attack with a one-handed firearm on your turn, you can use your bonus action to gain advantage on the attack roll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you make a ranged firearm attack with a one-handed firearm on your turn, you can gain advantage on the atk roll.

description.p: At 14th level, as a reaction when you take damage from a creature within 15 feet of you, you can make a firearm attack targeting that creature.

sheet.description: When you take damage from a creature within 15ft of you, you can make a firearm attack targeting that creature.
